website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic product, especially if you are able bear the extra weight. The best CamelBak on the market right now.
pros: Holds 3 liters of water and has enough storage for a day's worth of snacks and gear
Fits snug, so it doesn't slosh or bounce during activities
cons: It does carry more water and gear than the Rogue, but it is considerably heavier when filled (you're talking about an additional liter of water, after all)

customer_reviews.title: ICE COLD WATER!
customer_reviews.text: These CamelBaks were a lifesaver during our desert hikes through Zion and the Grand Canyon this past week. I filled them COMPLETELY with ice, then filled them up to around the 2.5l mark with water, and the water would STAY COLD all day long! Even after refilling with water along the way! There was still ice in the pouches in the evening when I dumped them out. So refreshing to have ice cold water during a long hot hike.
customer_reviews.author: W. Choe

customer_reviews.title: This is a good CamelBak!  Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this CamelBak. The reservoir works great and the pack is very comfortable on long hikes and has thoughtfully-designed storage. Snacks, extra clothing, keys, phone ... it will hold it all comfortably. The pack also seems to keep the water cool in hot weather. I often end my hikes with ice cubes still in the reservoir. My only wish this pack was supplied with an insulated tube, since the tube heats the water quickly in the summer months. The water tastes so much better when it’s cold - the hotter the weather, the more ice goes it. I’m investing in the insulated tube for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Western Electric

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My bf and I hike frequently, and these are perfect; we each have one. There's plenty storage space for granola bars and wallets and phones, etc. Definitely more functional as a backpack than some other Camelbaks are. You do need to make sure that the lid to the bladder is lined up correctly before you head off. I accidentally didn't have it quite right a couple of times and it leaked a little, but it's an easy fix and not a problem for me anymore now that I know.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ellen

customer_reviews.title: I would NOT recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hydration pack for my husband for Father's Day. When he tried to use it for the first time this past weekend on a hiking trip to Zion, the bottom of the bladder leaked everywhere. It is completely unusable, and unfortunately it seems the return window has closed, so that was $120 down the drain. We ended up having to purchase him a different pack at the store in the park. Very frustrating. I would NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa J. Boucher

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Bought it for a spartan race and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Bought it for a spartan race and train with it on. I was concerned the water would slosh as I run (I use the term run very loosely) but its sealed so it collapses as you drink. water stays cool, not cold but I haven't put ice in it. I get a little hot on my lower back but sweat enough to cool off. Hold plenty of stuff and its pretty big. Im 6' 0" and weigh 300LBS and its fine on me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Tulipane

customer_reviews.title: Leaks, leaks, leaks...
customer_reviews.text: The backpack itself is beautiful and super functional, if to be a backpack was the only purpose I would have given it a 5. But as this is a hydration pack and the bladder leaked big time I give it a 1 because I cannot give a 0! The blue plastic ring/seal was too big for the size of the cap and it leaked underneath the hard ring that supports the cap. My expectations for this bag were high, Camelbak usually does good products, but this one was a complete disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Liss C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Reservior lid design!!  Thought others must have been doing something wrong. Fail!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned over 7 CamelBaks - mostly Mules and Mules NV. The reservior will not seal!! I am an engineer and have worked on many seal assemblies. This is inherently flawed. Ended up cracking the lid after trying to tighten it to keep it from leaking. This is EXTREMELY frustrating!! This lid, resevior and nozzle should be their key technologies. Fail. Going to move to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Stox

customer_reviews.title: The perfect compromise between hydration pack and assault pack
customer_reviews.text: Havent had a ton of time with this pack but just from my initial inspection I can tell its high quality. The perfect compromise between hydration pack and assault pack. A little bit of storage, plus hydration, but can still be worn comfortably while running, hiking, or mountain biking.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Like bright blaze orange with nothing to tone it down
customer_reviews.text: It's really orange. Like bright blaze orange with nothing to tone it down. I still like it though.
customer_reviews.author: shakes00lude

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it ... with caution
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased two other water backpacks until I decided to plurge. The other two were either small when bladder is full or tubing was problematic. Nonetheless I tried camelbak this past weekend and really came through. I did my longest bike ride with still water to spare all while doing only two short stops (27miles). One thing that surprised me was when I layed it down on my kitchen counter when it was filled. It leaked all over the counter and my floors which I expected to be a good seal when closed. To my surprise it’s not so be cautious and do not lay it down to avoid spills!!!
customer_reviews.author: Damigs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for adventures
customer_reviews.text: I bought an earlier version of the Camelbak MULE about six years ago. It has delivered me safely through myriad adventures, and still looks as good as new aside from a little dirt. Festivals, hikes, bicycle rides galore and it has held up marvelously. There's no substitute for proper hydration, and with this baby I never have to worry about it. One of the best purchases I have ever made, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Mills

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable, all around noice.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints yet. The color of the backpack is beautiful and it managed to keep my water cool even while out in the sun for a while. Can't fit too much in the backpack when the bladder is full, but it's great for small stuff that would normally be in your pockets.
customer_reviews.author: J. Spack

customer_reviews.title: New version made worse
customer_reviews.text: I have an older mule that I use for riding 4 or 5 times a week and I love it. This product is a classic case of the new version made far worse. It has fewer pockets and doesn't have a lined holder for your cell phone. I guess if you had never seen the older version you might like this but I would look elsewhere for something more utilitarian and better quality. I'm now using the bladder from this pack in my old pack since this one does not meet my needs for riding
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Weekend Hiking
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for weekend hiking. It not only holds plenty of water but it also have a lot of space to carry whatever you might need. We actually use a different bigger CamelBak for longer weekend hikes where we need to layer clothes, but this one works perfectly for us if we are doing less than 15 miles. Actually, it probably would work if you are a lighter packer.
customer_reviews.author: Real Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not their best effort, I'm afraid
customer_reviews.text: I bought the very first Camelback when they hit the scene. Solid product at a reasonable price. I'm not at all impressed with this MULE, though. The opening on the bladder leaks quite a bit most of the time, unless it doesn't. It's basically impossible to know if the cap is on right, it's literally just a guess. It's very comfortable and stays in place, kudos for that, but the clasps aren't well designed, the zippers are cheap, and and overall it feels like a low quality product. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: kwsmithphoto

customer_reviews.title: Once you go Camelbak, you never go bak
customer_reviews.text: First camelbak and boy have I been missing out. This thing is a beauty. Wether I’m taking it on the trail or riding-my-bike-to-work day. Fits everything I need. Still crammed, however I wouldn’t want it any bigger. And the enormous bladder is a huge bonus for the extra long rides. Keep in mind, makes the bag a lot heavier. Overall love the bag and definitely recommend. Happy rides
customer_reviews.author: linlo

customer_reviews.title: The best hydration pack ever
customer_reviews.text: The Mule is the king of hydration packs. I have owned two of these since 1996, each lasting about 10 years under heavy duty mountain biking all over the US. When It came to replace pack, this is the one I reached for. The storage is better spaced and equipped than the earlier models, and it rides a little better then the previous version. The bladder is the new Crux bladder, which meats the older Omega style hands down.
customer_reviews.author: fuel98rider

customer_reviews.title: Excellent size
customer_reviews.text: I compared quite a view hydration packs before settling on this one. I wanted one bag that could function as a hydration pack while biking or hiking, but also hold a laptop and other gear for daily commuting. It just barely fits my 14" laptop, but works very well, has enough space for accessories and is very comfortable to wear fully loaded and biking off-road trails.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Does not leak if you follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.text: For all consumers concerned with the product “leaking”. I get it. It happened to me I like you wasn't following the directions. You do not screw the top on like a cap. You turn the top to the left until you hear a “click” then you turn the cap to the right and tighten it. This will give you the seal you are looking for. Product works great. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Grene

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag for biking
customer_reviews.text: I started biking a lot more recently and this bag is perfect for it. It holds so much water while still being very light. The storage isn't unbelievable or anything but I keep my phone wallet and a rain jacket in the bag with a few snacks without issue
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Verderese

customer_reviews.title: Great pak, but magnet is easily lost.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I only wish the little magnet clip for the tube/straw didn’t fall off and get lost the first week I had it. Will have to order extras.
customer_reviews.author: MorAng

customer_reviews.title: This has turned into our weekend travel bag - but the screw lid sucks
customer_reviews.text: My sister and I got these camelbaks and quickly found that the storage compartments were generous enough to pack a weekends worth of clothing and toiletries. The biggest issue we have with our bags is the water reservoir is a pain in the neck to seal sometimes and leaks. You have to get it JUST RIGHT. I spin the lid counter-clockwise until I hear it click into place and then screw it tight in order to get a more consistent fit.
customer_reviews.author: Giga

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It is awesome. I wanted a fairly light weight hydration pack but not too small because I want something more practical. This thing is perfect. It has tons of compartments. Worth the money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I took this with me on a tour of the Holy Land during the hottest time of year and it was one of the best purchases I could have made! It doesn’t look like it can fit that much, but I was able to keep a snacks for the day, my thick palm-sized Bible, my Sony camera, a small notebook, sunglasses and a bunch of other little necessities in it. It was also very comfortable and small, not crazy bulky which was ideal for carrying around all day. Love this Camelbak!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaking bladder, wet back
customer_reviews.text: It would be a great pack if it didn't leak half the time. The1/4 turn filler cap is a great idea, but! No matter how careful l am it still leaks. It takes 3 or 4 times of closing and opening to get it to stop leaking, then it may or may not leak on a ride. Help! It's only 3 months old, I don't want to go back to my 8 year old Camelbak. 6/10/20 update: I must admit the leak was more user caused than equipment. It shouldn't be so hard to align the cap threads to make a good deal. You just need to take the time to make sure the cap is flush.
customer_reviews.author: Norton

customer_reviews.title: Solid option
customer_reviews.text: I got this to allow me to bike further in the Texas summer where my 2 water bottles may not be adequate. Holds your basic tools and snacks along with a great deal of H2O. It is also a great day pack for hiking outings where you might want some basic supplies along with water close at hand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It’s my go-to camelbak
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple camelbacks but this one is my go-to. It has a decent carrying capacity for stuff in addition to water which is handy. Chest and waist staraps keep it in place no matter what you are doing. Only complaint is you do have to be careful closing the bladder lid, it is easy to think you closed it properly only to have it leak all over.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Kull

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. Very handy to have. I took this to red rocks for a weekend run of concerts and I was able to bring a small towel, rain jacket, and any other small items I needed. Not too big, but not short on space and compartments. I like the new bladder design
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack, but ripped apart on first wash
customer_reviews.text: It totally fell apart (as in ripped apart) when I washed it for the first time. Fortunately CamelBak stood by it and replaced it with a much sturdier updated MULE model. Don’t buy from Amazon, but directly from CamelBak. This product fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Crawford

customer_reviews.title: I like products that work
customer_reviews.text: I like products that work..This one works. I use it for Mountain biking and I've never ran it it out of water. Plenty of pocket space to hold tools,protein bars,wallet and more...
customer_reviews.author: Chuck B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if you expect perfection
customer_reviews.text: Bought this looking for a long bike trip... took a while to use it, it was stored for some time in a safe place. Finally the day to use it has arrived and guess what? Crux came with a hole! Brand new for this price with a defect like that is unacceptable. Now I don't have any warranty, just want to keep you folks advised...
customer_reviews.author: DWOISKI

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag... Poor Bladder
customer_reviews.text: I cannot begin to say how much I love the bag aspect of this package. There are so many great pockets/storage areas. Have taken on multiple hikes and had great comfort. Now for the Bladder.... This son of a B' leaked out the top part (where you seal it shut) horrendously to the point where I had to fill it to 3/4 capacity so that it would not. I will admit I am a lazy son of a gun and I never reached out to CamelBak have my bladder replaced but I will still have to tip my hat to the overall design of the bag. I hope this somewhat helps others in their decision-making process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: I now take this on every bike ride. Plenty of space and plenty of water storage (that keeps cold), while not being too heavy at all! I also use it for frisbee golfing with my husband and any other walk/hike! I’m obsessed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase! I'm a land surveyor in California and end up in the desert often. I use this every single day! Water stays cold, tons of extra room and extra pockets, lightweight but sturdy, very comfortable! I recommend yo everyone. Well worth the money. Great for hiking too! Bought a cleaning kit separately
customer_reviews.author: Henry Golding

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking or beach backpack
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had camel packs before and this one is the best. If you’re looking for a great hiking backpack then this one is great. I’ve used this for travel before as well and I love it. It is definitely not a backpack with large storage capacity if that’s what you are looking for. But it can fit a lot of things like a book and light sweatshirt and smaller things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREATEST PACK OF ALL TIME!!
customer_reviews.text: The vents for air circulation on front straps and back padded area are FANTASTIC! I ride in the desert and noticed the difference immediately. I ride often right through mountain lion country and the side straps for the helmet pouch double as a tethering point for a HUGE Bowie knife. For the last 10-12 years, I have used the Camelback MULE and it is sweet perfection. I have tried other packs and always have some level of disappointment. You simply cannot lose
customer_reviews.author: No. 1 Hendrix Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Storage Capacity, and Back Support
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality, durable and large capacity bladder, very comfortable and really good back/weight support. Lots of compartments for organized storage. I love that it’s light weight and not gigantic but you can still fit a lot of gear in there. Great for short or long day hike. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Potselueff

customer_reviews.title: Good pack but hot on back
customer_reviews.text: It is a great pack but I gets really hot on your back even with the good air ducts But it holds every thing I need and more
customer_reviews.author: Holly P.

customer_reviews.title: Great pack - does not leak
customer_reviews.text: Im seeing a lot of reviews claiming the bladder leaks... i've stress tested the bladder (literally squeezing as hard as i can) and there is no leakage. It's really just a matter of righty-tighty lefty-loosey. Weight distribution is awesome, pockets are awesome, i'm 5'11 and it sits very nicely on my back. I have only stress tested the bladder and taken the bag on a short run to test the weight distribution. I will be using the pack for 72 hours straight in the coming weeks and will update then. For now, 5 stars all the way. Excellent material too.
customer_reviews.author: john r tinkham

customer_reviews.title: As described!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for 9-15 mile hikes, its my go-to ultra light day pack. I may start using it for an ultra light over night solution in summer when I can get away with only a bivy sack... Its just not designed as a full pack. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Ann Detwiler

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed,
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my boyfriend before two big national park hiking weekend trips. We love this bag. The bladder is huge, and the bag is so roomy and well-designed. It fits tons of stuff, and has an external mesh pocket for stuffing extra or wet things in as needed. The hose has a magnetic clip which is also great. Despite being fully loaded up, the bag was light and easy to carry, and allowed some ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Kalisha Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable on a hot 60 mile cross country ride this ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 liter reservoir. Lots of room for food and other stuff. Very comfortable on a hot 60 mile cross country ride this weekend and have used it on some hikes too. What's not to like about this pack?
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A.

customer_reviews.title: Great changes for the better!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Camelback for 15 years, I needed an upgrade, and the latest offerings addressed a lot of shortcomings in older models. Better backpack, big mouth for the blatter. The cooling is better as well, airflow is increased between your back and the pack. Love the magnet tube clip. I really like this, and I'm glad I went with this brand and model for sure! Grab one, and hit the trail!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: CamelBak M.U.L.E. Mountain Bike Hydration Pack
customer_reviews.text: Well built water pack with plenty of space in extra pockets for food and gear. definitely a must if you do longer trail hikes and also hold ice in hydration pouch longer than other models.
customer_reviews.author: Jose F Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for mtn biking
customer_reviews.text: I mountain bike and this is the perfect size. The compartments fit everything I need. My only gripe is the hose and nipple on the bladder. The hose is so thick that it's not easy to hold in your mouth (wants to fling out). Water comes through the nipple quickly which is great but it also leaks if it is just slightly open.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Chevy Truck of hydration packs
customer_reviews.text: The little woman loves it. She is a weight weeny, and this is just right, only holds what is important, no more. The only problem is that my 15 year old mule is not needing replacement, and I am jealous of hers.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Paschall

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but great for extended trips.
customer_reviews.text: This was bigger than I expected. Eventually will be used on longer trips where fluid access is rare. But for my 2-4 hour daily rides it is too bulky. My bad though - I may buy the older smaller volume style. What comes in handy, though, are the numerous compartments for extra gear that may be needed on trips into the boonies.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Scout Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my kid who is in Scouts. Always likes to take my older CamelBak pack (no longer made, what a shame) but this fit the bill for his hikes and general camping. Has the padding he likes, the pockets for storage and the water bladder.
customer_reviews.author: rea

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Bladder
customer_reviews.text: The pack is great. However, I’m not the only one to say this, the bag leaks that holds the water. Won’t be able to use until I find a bladder that doesn’t leak. Like others, we could have returned them but time is prescious (sp)
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Gwin

customer_reviews.title: Water stays cold with ice, can fit cliff bars and first aid kit inside
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hiking! You can throw any small tools, a first aid kit, and some cliff bars inside with no trouble. The "plastic" taste goes away after a bit, but every item like this has that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, water flows smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, water flows smoothly, the ugly colors were less expensive but I quickly got over it. Took it with on the Cactus to Clouds hike in Palm Springs and it worked well. Ideal for a long day hike, held a few layers, snacks and of course the water.
customer_reviews.author: Winter

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage.
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Was looking for a pack to carry some snackes, shirt, sun lotion, eppi pen and phone on day hikes. This fits the bill. Has 4 pockets and holds more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Order-Missing the Hydration Pack
customer_reviews.text: Good thing I opened my Camelbak to check it out a couple weeks before a hiking trip that is coming up. I got a tagged, wrapped Camelbak except... the shell looked great, but no hydration pack was included! I looked through the reviews and see I am not the first person this has happened to. Buyer beware I guess. Fortunately Amazon processed the refund, but I don't think I can take the chance ordering off of Amazon again for this product.
customer_reviews.author: MDD

customer_reviews.title: it leaked!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for Christmas....he used it in May for a hike and it leaked. The window for return came and went. I was very upset that I spent all that money and now I couldn't return it because my son used it in May. We trusted that we wouldn't have a problem and we didn't try it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Best hydration pack ever!
customer_reviews.text: You know in Hotel Transylvania when Jonathon takes his back pack everywhere because it’s a part of him? That’s my camelbak! Lol I use from music festivals, Disney world, hiking, long trips, volunteer work, everywhere! It’s so useful and rarely turned down. I’ve never been turned down without.
customer_reviews.author: Smileythefather

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pack
customer_reviews.text: The 3 liter size might seem like a lot of water on paper, but trust me, the last thing you want is to run out. The pack itself has plenty of room for all your day hike needs. 10 miles in steep terrain and you will be good to go. The fittings are water tight and the mouthpiece is first rate. Don’t waste your time or money on inferior products or brands as you’ll be sorry to have all your water leaked out when you get to the trailhead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Take it on walks go to work with it. Fill it up with ice and it stays cold all day. In take of water has gone up amazingly. I am able to stuff another water bottle in there with a bowl for my dogs as well.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Hydration bag is great; plenty of room for things too!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag; can’t use it enough. Has enough room for whatever you might need for a day hike or bike ride, and have room for more. Hydration bag is fantastic! I did a couple hikes during very hot days (+98F) and water kept cool for the entire hikes of +4 hours. With ice inside, of course. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Montiel

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product design
customer_reviews.text: Got this pack and was SUPER excited to use it! Unfortunately, it turns out the lid isn't attached at all and going through security it fell off and some wook picked it up. Never got to even use it. Every other pack I've ever used the lid was securely attached. Such a massive oversight. Will not be buying a Camelback again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mountain Biking
customer_reviews.text: This pack works great, the only thing that is a snag if you are lazy like me, it can be tough to get the Blatter out to refill with the spout handing it up pulling it out with it also be full. Still great long range pack.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Ray Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Will never go back to carrying bottles of water. Held a good amount of water and the pack is small enough. Just be careful you don't let it tip over in your vehicle
customer_reviews.author: R. Stump

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for my longest rides
customer_reviews.text: I can carry all ride essentials AND 3 liters of water. It's bright orange which helps make me visible. About my only complaint is that the bladder is a very tight fit when it's full. It rides comfortably...I don't notice it's there. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Too Many Hobbies

customer_reviews.title: Love this pack
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack! I am 5’ even and it’s the perfect size for day hiking, very comfortable to wear :)
customer_reviews.author: cheminifer

customer_reviews.title: Life-saver!!
customer_reviews.text: My lifesaver while hiking in 100 Plus heat! Packed with ice and cold water. Great for thirst quenching and cool to the back! Great storage pockets for necessary items.
customer_reviews.author: Carol B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love CamelBak products
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Lots of pockets for all the things I need to bring with me for a long day at competitions. Comfortable to wear and the 3L reservoir holds all the water I need for the day.
customer_reviews.author: DE Meiers

customer_reviews.title: Essential Hiking Backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Camelback is the best hiking pack out there. This is an amazing model. I can pack everything I need for an 11 mile hike and still have room. Highly recommend one of these for everyone in the family!!!
customer_reviews.author: L T

customer_reviews.title: A great pack!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect size bag for what I was after. Holds plenty of water and still has space for a flat pack tackle box and plenty of other odds and ends.
customer_reviews.author: Pat K

customer_reviews.title: Years of service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter, but I have been using a M.U.L.E. First gen for many years without issue. My Daughter likes the updated models magnetic clamp holder and the large mouth reservoir,that makes it a breeze to clean. Great products
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for cycling in hot Florida summers. I fill it with ice cubes, then water up to the rim. And it delivers cold water for three hours.
customer_reviews.author: Turk Turon

customer_reviews.title: Holds a ton of stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag but can get really heavy when biking. It can hold my light weight jacket and bike pump with the 3 liter water bladder full.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Large Capacity
customer_reviews.text: I like this pack. It’s stylish, has a large capacity, and I love the crux res. However, what is like is in the main big compartment, is like if the back panel had mesh or a zipper pocket so that I can put extra tools or something useful in. Still, great pack for the money and I personally love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson T.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the day
customer_reviews.text: The water capacity is great! I was able to keep my gf and myself hydrated during our hike. Also, I was able to fit a good amount of snacks and whatever else we needed into the storage pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I liked this bag a lot, but no matter how many times I tried, the bladder would not close without massively leaking. Good thing I tested before actually going on a hike, otherwise I would have been soaked. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Af1402

product_meta.title: CamelBak M.U.L.E. Mountain Bike Hydration Pack - Easy Refill Hydration Backpack
product_meta.description: For those searching for superior hydration in a practical mountain biking backpack, CamelBak provides an exceptional solution. The CamelBak M.U.L.E. Mountain Biking Hydration Pack is the perfect biking backpack to add to your mountain biking equipment list. It features a narrow-gauge design that keeps it lightweight and exceptionally maneuverable. Even when this lightweight backpack is fully loaded for mountain biking, it won’t get in your way. Our M.U.L.E. hydration pack is built around a revolutionary Crux reservoir, which is easier to load and refill and delivers 20% more water with every sip. It also includes a self-sealing bite valve and ergonomic cap. We’ve also added a Magnetic Tube Trap that keeps the tube secure and accessible when you need it. There’s a reason this is one of our bestselling, longest-running packs: It’s got everything you need and nothing you don’t. Our backpack is lightweight but big enough to carry three liters of water and a day’s worth of snacks and gear. It also contains five easy to access storage pockets that provide plenty of space to stash your tools, keys, and electronics. We’ve also added additional air channels to keep your back cool, universal helmet hooks, and a removable stability belt. Our biking backpack is designed with reflective accents to improve visibility during low-light situations, which improves safety while you’re on the road. It also features a magnetic tube trap that snaps easily into place so you can hydrate without taking your eyes off the trail. Our Got Your Bak Lifetime Guarantee covers all reservoirs, backpacks, bottles, and accessories from manufacturing defects in materials and workmanship for the lifetime of the product. The CamelBak M.U.L.E. hydration backpack only weighs 1.37 pounds and measures 17.9 x 8.7 x 8.9 inches.
